## serialization.blocks.save() function

Returns the state of the given block as a plain JavaScript object.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function save(block: Block, { addCoordinates, addInputBlocks, addNextBlocks, doFullSerialization, }?: {
    addCoordinates?: boolean;
    addInputBlocks?: boolean;
    addNextBlocks?: boolean;
    doFullSerialization?: boolean;
}): State | null;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  block | [Block](./blockly.block_class.md) | The block to serialize. |
|  { addCoordinates, addInputBlocks, addNextBlocks, doFullSerialization, } | { addCoordinates?: boolean; addInputBlocks?: boolean; addNextBlocks?: boolean; doFullSerialization?: boolean; } | <i>(Optional)</i> |

<b>Returns:</b>

[State](./blockly.serialization_namespace.blocks_namespace.state_interface.md) \| null

The serialized state of the block, or null if the block could not be serialied (eg it was an insertion marker).
